meanings.definition: A triangular sail set forward of the mast.
meanings.sent1: The sailors raised the jib to catch the wind.
meanings.sent2: The jib fluttered in the breeze as the boat sailed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the jib, thinking it was a perch.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the air like a billowing jib.
meanings.sent5: The bright white jib against the blue sky was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To refuse to comply with a demand or request.
meanings.sent1: He decided to jib at the unreasonable request.
meanings.sent2: She tends to jib when asked to do something she dislikes.
meanings.sent3: The cat would jib at eating the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him jib at every suggestion.
meanings.sent5: The child would always jib at bedtime, causing a nightly struggle.

meanings.sent1: The horse began to jib nervously at the unfamiliar noise.
meanings.sent2: The car would jib to the side when the brakes were applied.
meanings.sent3: The bookshelf started to jib as the floor beneath it creaked.
meanings.sent4: Her heart would jib with excitement before the big race.
meanings.sent5: The old door would jib in its frame whenever the wind blew.
